headline: ALERT: This State Moves To Make Ivermectin Available To Consumers
sentences:
(TeaParty.org Exclusive) – The United States Food and Drug Administration really, really doesn’t want you to take Ivermectin as a form of treatment for the COVID-19 virus, posting pages of very detailed information online in a section called “Why you should not use ivermectin to treat or prevent COVID-19.”
According to WND, the federal agency continues to insist this medication is dangerous, despite the fact it’s been prescribed for many years now as a means of treating various parasitic ailments, and the FDA warns that overdosing on Ivermectin can cause “nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, hypotension (low blood pressure), allergic reactions (itching and hives), dizziness, ataxia (problems with balance), seizures, coma and even death.”
“That’s even though Dr. Theresa Lawrie, a U.K. medical doctor and research analyst who founded the British Ivermectin Recommendation Development initiative (BIRD International) suggested it has significant benefits against contracting, or dying from, COVID-19,” the report says.

The report went on to say, “The pharmacist would also be required to provide any patients who receive ivermectin with a ‘standardized information sheet written in plain language’ that provides health care referral information and notes the importance of follow-up care.”
Lawmakers are also proposing that, “Nothing on the information sheet shall discourage the recipient from using ivermectin for the treatment of COVID-19.”
Newsweek pointed out, “Republican State Rep. Leah Cushman, a sponsor of the bill and registered nurse, told Newsweek that she wanted to make sure residents of the state ‘have options for treatment of COVID-19.’ She also said that the burden of the virus on hospitals needs to be curbed, ‘and right now there are no early treatments being offered by most doctors.

The sponsor of the plan, GOP state Sen. Amanda Chase spoke with National File and stated that Democrats “will legalize marijuana but prohibit the use of ivermectin and hydroxychloroquine for the treatment of COVID in a right to try state like Virginia.”
“If Virginians are going to be given the right to try marijuana, then give them the right to try life-saving ivermectin and hydroxychloroquine,” she went on to say.
